ygData.subject: RE: Bard Weapons - Broken off thread from "My Yk!!!"
ygData.msgSnippet: You and 3 or 4 co level friends can go to lake rathe and if you can find the hermits cabin way back in the cornor (between gypsy s and barbs) - kill the aqua
ygData.messageBody:
You and 3 or 4 co level friends can go to lake rathe and if you can find the
hermits cabin way back in the cornor (between gypsy's and barbs) - kill the
aqua gob that swims in that bay until Webby Murclaw (sp?) shows up with a
nice water crystal staff for you. He is a nasty caster - you _must_ fight
him in the water or he will 32k. I suggest a ranger who can cast endure
breath, wizz and or cleric, use lullaby to keep him stunned, stuns help too
and enjoy.

Sylly

p.s. I was 30 and fought him with a 26 ranger who got burned bad and died. I
did kill him but felt real bad at the loss of my friend.

-----Original Message-----
From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:jht@...]
Sent: Wednesday, January 05, 2000 1:38 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Weapons - Broken off
thread from "My Yk!!!"

I really like this little guide of "weapons to level". It's
nice to have
some type of goal as far what would be the next item for me
to hunt for. The
Concert Hall (http://www.attcanada.net/~reaper/index.html)
web site has a
listing of weapons available to bards.

BTW, I'm a level 26 bard. I used to fight primarily with
Polished Granite
Tomahawk and Dragoon Dirk, but was able to get Thulian Blade
Claws and a
Silvery War Axe (keeping my dirk in the range weapon slot)
and am much
happier when I get in a melee situation. While I really like
the Tomahawk,
it drains away my stamina in long fights. A guildmate gave
me a Staff of
Writhing, but since it doesn't proc until level 29 (?) I
haven't really used
this due to it's weight.

Unfortunately, my 1 handed blunt is feeble at best. I'm
planning to go and
buy a "barshing" weapon that has a low delay and maybe some
+int jewelry
since us bards are not all that bright. Takes me a long time
to learn
something new and all the alcohol doesn't help that. :-)

I was thinking maybe a combine 1 hb or screaming mace or
maybe buy/find one
of the crystal staffs.

Anyone have any other suggestions? It's best if it's
relatively cheap since
I'll be tossing this aside when I get high enough to use the
Staff of
Writhing. I'm not a camper since I can usually only be in EQ
for a few hours
at a time so I usually end up buying it or stumbling across
the spawn.

Thanks!
Windleaf Mistsong
Bertox

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Rokenn Swiftsong [mailto:rokenn@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, January 05, 2000 11:03 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] My Yk!!!
>
>
> You forgot one in the 40-50 catagory:
> Orb of Tashania
> 7 dam
> 25 delay
> 1h blunt
> +9 Str
> +9 Sta
> +35 Mana
> Effect: Tashania (44th lvl enchanter MR debuff, lower MR
by 60ish)
> usable by: BRD NEC WIZ ENC MAG
> Dropped by Lord Naga-pus.
>
> Best thing about this is that in smart dragon raiding
parties
> this is a Bard
> only lotto :)
>
> Does great with a Ykesha, as once the orb procs the Ykesha
is rarely
> resisted.
>
> Rokenn
>
> >From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
> >Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
> >To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
> >Subject: RE: [eqbards] My Yk!!!
> >Date: Wed, 5 Jan 2000 12:42:50 -0600
> >
> >imho - really depends on your level -
> >
> >1-8
> >giant snake fang - great newbie wep
> >short sword - buy one asap
> >
> >9-20
> >combine long sword / combine scim - time to wup up on
magic mobs
> >dragoon dirk (used mine until level 40)
> >
> >20-30
> >ashenwood short spear
> >polish garnet tommy chopper
> >thuilan claws
> >
> >30-40
> >staff o' wriggling
> >obscene shard
> >crystalline blade
> >silvery axe
> >
> >40-50
> >Yk's
> >Electum Bladed Wazukazi
> >Planes weps
> >
> >That kinda matches the "get-ability" of the weapons and
the
> xp levels.
> >
> >Sylly
> >
> >
> >
